This does not adversely affect the usability of Eclipse?

It only happens during shutdown. In my case, since I don't shutdown often, is
just a minor annoyance.

Does it pop up a dialog on shutdown, or does it just write to the log? 
 
Also, what happens if you reset all of your perspectives before shutdown?

Unfortunately, I don't know how to reproduce it - just happened a couple of
times. So even without resetting the perspectives I may not get his one soon. I
may wait until the next time it happens (to be sure it still may happen again),
and the reset the perspectives.

It pops up a dialog showing a general message about an exception during
shutdown. Looking into your message catalog, I think this is the one:

"An error has occurred when closing the workbench. See error log for more details."
Have you seen this problem again since February?

I cannot find an occurrence of this stack trace in any of my logs (and the
oldest entries are from about a month ago).

I am going to close this.  If anyone has it occur again we can re-open, 
hopefully with steps to recreate.
Moving to verified to get them out of my list of bugs to verify for M9.
